author: scheu
msg: This change fixes
http://nagoya.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=9867
Problem:
Section 7.2 of the JavaBean specification indicates
that the indexed setter method should not
establish or increase the size of the underlying
array if the index parameter is greater than the
array length.
Solution:
Changed the indexed setter method generated by
JavaBeanWriter for properties with maxOccurs=unbounded.
The indexed setter no longer creates or increases the
size of the array.
Changed the BeanPropertyDescriptor to appropriately
test the size of the array before calling the indexed
property setter.  If the array is too small or non-existent
an array is constructed of the appropriate size.
(Also made the BeanPropertyDescriptor more general purpose
in case we have issues in the TCK.)

author: dims
msg: - activation.jar is now a required library due to SAAJ API (which in turn is required by JAXRPC API)
- Extract getHttpServletResponseStatus from AxisFault to eliminate dependency on javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse.
